posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Actually, Rangers get Twf and Ambidexterity at lvl 1 and Improved Two Weapon Fighting at lvl 9 AS LONG AS THEY WEAR LIGHT ARMOR. Now, if you lower your Strength by 2, it will give you 6 stat points, which you can use to raise your starting DEX to 15. You will lose 1 AB and damage, but that's no big deal in this build. Next, lower your starting CON score to 12, that way you will have a starting DEX of 16. With 16 STR and 16 DEX, you can wear a Studded Leather armor and, by casting a Cat's Grace spell, you'll have 2 less AC than a guy with a Full Platemail armor. Or you can leave your CON as is and have 75% chance (depending on a Cat's Grace roll) to cap your DEX modifier allowed by the armor. Now if your server has DEX items, you can wear a Leather Armor and say a Belt of Agility +6, then have freedom and, with a Cat's Grace spell, have 1 less AC than a FP wearer. I wouldn't consider DWing medium Weapons.

Now, you don't actually need more than 6 Fighter levels, or even 4 if you want to take Epic Weapon Specialization (otherwise it's better to go with CoT for the saves boost, although here you'd have to drop assassin because of the alignment conflict, but Rogue will do the same for ya).

So, you could go Ranger 32, Assassin 2 Fighter 6 and have 2 more Ranger Bonus Feats and 1 More FE, or Ranger 35 Fighter 4 Assassin 1 for 2 more FEs. FEs are good when in abundance, because if you have, say 8 FEs, you'll have +2 AB against all of them PLUS +2d6+8 damage against all of them (+12 from your STR, presuming you reduce your starting STR as I suggested and not factoring gear or weapon enhancements, and +6 from EWS), which will be FABULOUS. Not to mention that if you have more FEs, you'll hardly be in a place where there won't be any creatures that fit at least in one of your FE groups. That fact alone makes Devcrit VERY redundant, Imagine the sick damage output on a critical hit that this guy would do, and even more so with 6 attacks per round. In the Ranger 35 alternative, you would have 8 FE groups just from the multiples of 5 Bonus FEs. If you go straight Ranger, you can take BoE at lvl 21, then start taking Fighter levels for epic feats, taking the 4th Fighter level on a General feat level so you can take both WS and EWS. You won't have Tumble AC for a long time, but you'll kill things so fast that you won't need it that much.

Let me sketch up an alternative so you can see more clearly what I'm talking about. I'll get back to you on this.

Take it EZ!

This guy has 2 less AB than your build, but can cast all Ranger spells (Cat's Grace, Camouflage and Mass Camouflage, which STACK so you'll have +20 on HIde checks), and has 12 FEs, the main playable classes, monsters that have DR and immunity to Critical hits, and some others that you can commonly find. These are swappable, really, as it all comes down to where you'll play the build and what are the most common enemy types. Now, although he has 2 less AB, here is what his damage would be like MOST of the time:

6 attacks per round on a 15-20/x2 (even more if you have, say a Wand of Keen Edge) threat Range, buffable weapons with Blade Thirst (makes them +3).

1d4 Kukri damage becomes irrelevant as he will do: 2d6(BoE) +12(FEs) + 10(STR) + 6(EWS) + 1d6 (Death Attack) + 3 (Blade Thirst) PER ATTACK of damage. He will be pretty undetectable, wearing no shield and a light armor, with Camouflage and Mass Camouflage, even though his DEX score isn't all that great, except for True Seers. Factor in items and you can have +6 from capped STR, + FW wand from lvl 37 on, + any bonus damage the weapon has + GMW wands, etc... He will ABSOLUTELY OBLITERATE all his FEs, even if they are immune to criticals. It's just too much damage! And, having more FEs means that there will be less occasions in which he won't be doing bonus damage.

If you want to lower his Wisdom to 8, then you can re-increase your starting STR to 18 or raise CON and DEX a bit to be able to wear light armor. BTW, that is a very important part of this build, wearing Light Armor, otherwise you'll lose the ranger dual-wielding feats. In your character sheet, the feat is noted as Dual-wield, so you can read the description to check.

One last thing, Epic Skill Focus Discipline is droppable, so you can take Epic Prowess in its place and use that feat to take another FE for even more BoE usefulness. You can also delay BoE a bit more and take it with the Ranger Bonus Feat at Rgr 23, then rework things a bit, drop both ESF and one FE to get +1 STR modifier, but IMO BoE is sort of the core of this build, so it's best to take it as soon as possible. The effective difference is 1 AB

Anyway, you lose DevCrit, Evasion, 80 HPs and 2 AB, but gain a total of 12 FEs, all Ranger spells (which are bad but can be useful to this guy) and earlier BoE damage. You say that your guy has the highest AB and damage and can dual-wield with a FP, which is true, but for that purpose you give up too much raw power. IMO it's better to leave this the way it is. and just in case, you can reach the EXACT SAME AB in this build by doing the following changes: Delay BoE to 23, drop ESF Discipline and one FE for 2 Great Strengths (+1 AB), then lower your DEX to 8 and Raise STR to 18 (+1 AB). This, however, would mean you would need to equip MANY DEX items to get your modifier to at least 4 (which is the lowest possible AC for a light armor wearer), or you can drop CON to 8, lose 40 HP and keep DEX at 10, so that with capped DEX you can wear a Leather Armor. You can replace Improved Expertise with Toughness to recover the lost HP. Or even, like I said before, drop your Wisdom, forget spells and find a way to cap DEX with only items. There are many alternatives to reach that AB.

Basically, IMO you're giving up too much for not such a great benefit when you drop Ranger levels for not-needed Fighter levels and when you drop 6 Wisdom points to get your STR up higher, but each to their own.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: magaiti
posts.content:
Bonus damage in NWN does not depend on number of FEs, but only on Ranger level, raising by 1 every 5 levels up to +9 at Ranger lvl 40.
Therefore, there is no reason to take (32 Ranger/6 Fighter) over (30 Ranger / 8 Fighter), for example.
By taking 11 more ranger levels than me, you have raised your damage by 2, which is just enough to compensate for damage lost from dropping 4 strength.

4-5 FEs should be enough as long as you know what enemies will give you trouble (or rather which ones you want to give trouble, which this build is about - bosses) you will fight at lvl 40. Say, Undead, Dragons and Constructs will cover most of Nordock bosses.

And there is only so much non-FE epic feats (EWF, EP, BoE) worth taking at Ranger levels.
If you want 8+ FEs, you need a different build, maybe indeed dropping DevCrit for more Ranger levels.
In my build, DevCrit helps against all kinds of monsters not worth taking FE.

I am well aware of Dual-Wield feat, and I intentionaly ignore it, because in heavy armor I will have 2 AC more and won't lose my armor bonus when flat-footed (that happens every so often in game, even if you are careful). Also, with heavy armor I won't need (m)any Dex items, thus i'll have more item slots for everything else. Dual-wield is a gimmick, not the selling point of this build. AB/AC/HP/damage per attack is.

This build is for places where 1-2 AB/damage, 2 AC and 80 HP is a big deal. When you are facing bosses, every bit counts (unless their AB is so ridiculously high it doesn't count).
Dual-wielding is for Dev-Critting quickly through weak enemies, while tough ones should be approached with Sword & Board. If a monster is so tough your AС doesn't help, but for some reason it has lowish AB, then dual-wielding is again an option.
High damage bonus helps greatly to overcome damage reduction you otherwise could not penetrate, like 40/+6 (with +5 being the best enhancement available).

If everything I have said about monsters I'm building this guy for sounds like a horror to you, well, that's what this build is about. This is not a meadow-hopping flower-picking kind of ranger build

I think ranger epic bonus feats are messed up in NWN1 due to design/engine limitaitons. There was no way to differentiate the 2 feat progressions a ranger has in epics, general feats each 3 levels and FEs each 5 levels. As a result you can take any of those feats in any of those pregressions, but I suppose in PnP you can only take FE every 5 levels. Thats probably why damage bonus depends on ranger levels - its simpler to implement than counting different FE feats, and allows to keep bonus damage in check, since it was intended to only allow FE feat every 5 ranger levels.

Alas, Armor Skin cannot be taken as Ranger bonus feat. I wish it could.

Being caught flat-footed can happen in combat, with no hiders involved. Every time you kill a foe and have no other in range, game will put you into flat-footed state, since "combat is over". However every so often other enemies are just inches away running at you and you get smacked in a fraction of a second. Your reaction time is limited by your reflexes and, um, lags, which also happen every so often.
Heavy armor is just more lag-proof than DEX, unless you have uncanny dodge (which in my build will happen only by level 37).

I have to start my build with a fighter level, if i want to start with 8 WIS.
I admit I made the same mistake trying to improve my build at some point. "Oh, look, I can get a few more points at 1st level if i go ranger. Oops I forgot why I have put fighter there in the first place".

Thanks for the feedback!

A default ranger can't dual-wield in full plate.  Not even using medium armor.  The only way would be to take all the general DW feats which is pretty much wasting feats (and I'm not even certain if the two DW feat "versions" would conflict, never having attempted it myself).  Stick to light armor for ranger DWing unless the environment has neutralized the armor prerequisite for the ranger class.
